Class PhysicsHandler

java.lang.Object
controller.PhysicsHandler
public class PhysicsHandler extends Object
A utility class containing static methods for handling game physics. This includes collision detection, movement validation, gravity effects, and interactions with special tiles like lifts.

  • Method Details

    • canMoveHere

      public static boolean canMoveHere(Player player, Directions direction, Tile[][] lvlData)
      Checks if the player can move to a new position without colliding with solid tiles.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      direction - The direction of intended movement.
      lvlData - The 2D array representing the level's tile data.
      Returns:
      True if the move is possible, false otherwise.

    • handleVerticalCollisions

      public static void handleVerticalCollisions(Player player, Tile[][] lvlData)
      Handles vertical collisions for the player, such as landing on the ground or hitting a ceiling.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      lvlData - The 2D array representing the level's tile data.

    • isOnGround

      public static boolean isOnGround(Player player, Tile[][] lvlData)
      Checks if the player is currently standing on a solid tile.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      lvlData - The 2D array representing the level's tile data.
      Returns:
      True if the player is on the ground, false otherwise.

    • isOnLift

      public static boolean isOnLift(Player player, LiftTile lift)
      Checks if the player is currently standing on a specific lift tile.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      lift - The lift tile to check against.
      Returns:
      True if the player is on the lift, false otherwise.

    • getLiftStops

      public static List<Tile> getLiftStops(Tile lift, Tile[][] lvlData)
      Determines all possible stopping points for a lift along its vertical path. A stop is defined as an empty space adjacent to a solid platform.
      Parameters:
      lift - The lift tile.
      lvlData - The 2D array representing the level's tile data.
      Returns:
      A sorted list of tiles representing the valid stops for the lift.

    • moveLiftToNextStop

      public static void moveLiftToNextStop(LiftTile lift, Directions direction, Tile[][] lvlData, List<Tile> stops, Player player)
      Moves a lift to the next available stop in the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      lift - The lift to move.
      direction - The direction to move (UP or DOWN).
      lvlData - The 2D array of level tiles.
      stops - The pre-calculated list of valid stops for the lift.
      player - The player entity.

    • isLeavingLevel

      public static boolean isLeavingLevel(Player player)
      Checks if the player is at the edge of the level, triggering a transition to the elevator.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      Returns:
      True if the player is at the far left or far right of the screen, false otherwise.

    • isLeavingElevator

      public static boolean isLeavingElevator(Player player)
      Checks if the player is at the edge of the elevator screen, triggering a transition to a level.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity.
      Returns:
      True if the player is at the far left or far right of the screen, false otherwise.
